intro: Eriogonum vimineum var. brachyanthum, commonly known as the narrowleaf buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often sprawling growth habit. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale green, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. This species is adapted to dry, rocky habitats and is often found in sagebrush communities.
